intro: Pilosella niveocantabrica, commonly known as the Cantabrian snow pilosella, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of northern Spain. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its white to pale yellow flowers bloom in summer, and its leaves are hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance. Pilosella niveocantabrica is a rare and endemic species, highlighting the unique botanical diversity of the Iberian Peninsula.
